INPUT.OPERATOR_EXPLANATION: You can use & as AND, | as OR, ! as NOT operators, and parentheses to group terms. For example, '(cat | mouse) & !dog' will find matches that contain either 'cat' or 'mouse', but not 'dog'.
INPUT.PHRASE_EXPLANATION: You can also use double quotes to search for a phrase, e.g. '"good cat"' will find matches that contain the word 'good' followed by the word 'cat'. You can use phrases in combination with the operators above.
INPUT.SCOPE_INFO: Search scope: 'Paragraph' will consider your search criteria within the entire paragraph, while 'Sentence' will narrow the criteria to individual sentences.
INPUT.BUTTON_TOOLTIP: You must enter at least one search term and select at least one work

RESULTS.GO_TO_TEXT_TOOLTIP: Jump to the paragraph in the full text

UPLOAD.TOOLTIP: Select the work you want to upload
